string.text: Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Ergonomic grip
Installation of a more comfortable grip.
Reinforced frame
Replacing the frame with one made from more durable materials helps with the weapon's longevity.
Lightweight alloy components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight alloys significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
Lightweight magazine
Replacing the magazine with a modern lightweight equivalent reduces the overall weight of the gun slightly.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Soft trigger release
Reduces recoil, which in turn leads to more accurate follow-up shots.
Barrel alignment
Calibrate barrel alignment with the sights and remove any excessive movement that occurs during the firing cycle.
Barrel with modified rifling pitch
Changing the rifling pitch can have a positive effect on muzzle velocity.
Recoil compensation system
Reduces recoil, which in turn leads to more accurate follow-up shots.
Install a hardened extractor
Improves overall reliability of the weapon by reducing the number of common ejection issues that can occur after firing.
Improved barrel locking mechanism
Provides a tighter seal in the chamber and increases bullet obturation with the bore, improving muzzle velocity.
Short-stroke bolt
Increases the weapon's effective fire rate by shortening the time it takes for the action to fully cycle.
Polymer buffer
Adding a polymer buffer to the return mechanism absorbs some of the recoil energy generated by firing.
Chamber alignment
Careful fitment of parts and minimization of backlash in the chamber for a better seal, improving accuracy.
